name: Hilton Bentley Miami/South Beach

reviews.title: Don't bother not worth the money
reviews.text: Stayed here for seven nights in August booked three months in advance and asked for a room away from construction site upon booking. On arrival they tried to charge us alot more than the rate we were first given after speaking to the manager the rate was reduced. Suite was large with a nice balcony but still overlooked the construction site. The workers started at 7.30am till 7pm and they could see us sitting on our balcony. We had alot of issue with noise from the guests upstairs and had to call reception 4 times one night and early morning to get them to tell the quests to be quiet these particular guests were also throwing bottles over the balcony. The staff did not seem to care. When we asked to be moved thet said they had nothing. Overall we found the staff very unhelpful and just seems to speak spanish among themselves and ignore the guests. Until this hotel gets its act together and the construction is finished i would not recommend anyone staying there.

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: Beach is nice but loungers are given to non guests so none left for guest and are put away by 5pm

reviews.title: Hilton Nightmare - Stay There Literally At Your Peril!!
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, great rooms, very friendly staff. Only thing wrong with this place is if you want to walk to the heart of South Beach, it is several blocks.

reviews.title: Don't Stay here
reviews.text: We stayed at Bentley Beach Hotel, Miami 1-5 July 2008 en route from Ireland to our main holiday destination in Naples. We were disappointed with the accommodation. We had specifically requested a room with an ocean view and balcony. When we arrived we found that the main view was of the building site next door where they are constructing new condos. The next morning to our horror we found out that the workmen started at 8.00 a.m. sharp (kango hammers working flat out) and worked through until 5.00 p.m. We also found out that the bar and restaurant in the hotel had been closed for several months. Neither of these basic facts were advised on the website nor were they mentioned by the agent South Beach Luxury Hotels when were booking the accommodation.

reviews.title: Stay at the Bentley and get a free can of roach spray
reviews.text: We did not make an issue as we were only staying for a few nights. However on our last evening things went from bad to catastrophic when our daughter was hit in the face by a 'bottle rocket' fired by another guest from the balcony opposite about 20 yards away. The help and support we received was pathetic to say the least - basically we were left to fend for ourselves. We could not get through to reception on the phone to get the police and ambulance. We had to run down to reception with our daughter even then it was the person who set off the rocket who had to use their cell phone to call the emergency services. I followed my wife and daughter to the hospital after giving a report to the police – the hotel kindly organised a taxi for me (wow)!! Having spent the whole evening at Accident & Emergency returning at 11.30; the hotel reception could not even be bothered to organise some food for us and again we were left to sort ourselves out and had to phone for a carry out.

reviews.title: Not all it was cracked up to be
reviews.text: We had planned a girls getaway and we using Honors points to stay at this Hilton. We called several times before arriving letting them know that we had 4 people and would like to have a 2 bed room only to be told that if they had it they would give it to us. This was 3 months in advance mind you. Upon check-in we were giving a different room than was previously booked (one of the girls husband booked the room for us and they had a room for him. when they saw it was us they moved our room...still didn't know where they had originally put us) to one that would barely fit 2 people. The view and balcony were a nice touch though. The room would have been great had it been only 2 of us. We asked for a roll away bed only to get it 5 hours after we checked in and having to call 3 times. The honors memeber who booked the room was a platinum member and when we asked to see if we could get a bigger room they proceeded to charge us! We spent almost a hour agruing with the front desk people to finally get a suite that was big enough for all of us.

reviews.title: quick business trip
reviews.text: The location was great! Right next to the beach and Nikki Beach. The Beach attendants were average. Over all it was a lack luster stay and we were ready to go to Key West when our stay was over. I hope their service has improved since our stay.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: After arriving to Miami for business and arriving at our beyond sketchy hotel, we quickly checked out and headed over to the Bentley. We walked in (after hours, mind you) and were treated with exellent service and given beautiful rooms. The following day, we held a business meeting in our room and couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a no fuss hotel in Miami and would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Perfection!
reviews.text: This Hotel the best hotel in Miami Beach as far as location. It is near everything and walking distance to all the best restaurants like Prime 112 or Joe's. If you book at this hotel be sure to book the Suites 907 or 1001, They might be a little pricey and much more than the regular rooms at the hotel but it's worth it every penny.

reviews.title: I liked the Hilton Bentley...
reviews.text: The beach is nice and not to crowded and you can use the club at NIKKI Beach if you would like to have some Rose wine and a nice lunch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "Do not waste your money or time here. My husband has a diamond status at Hilton properties. We asked for an upgrade and didn't get it. We did have a room "with an ocean view". What a joke!! It was a snippit, and I mean a snippit. Our keys had to be re-done FOUR times!! I took a shower and then my husband took one and when he got out, the ONLY towel in the bathroom was my wet one. He had to use a HAND TOWEL to dry off!!! Don't plan on going to the beach if you want chairs or an umbrella because the RUDE guy on the beach will not oblige. We had to get management out there to get that done! In our room was an intimacy kit for sale for $10. My husband was livid about that, as was I. What if our three young kids would have been with us? They were for sale right next to gummy bears in a cute little bear jar!! We called to complain about these various things and Hector was supposed to return our call. Can you guess what happened? Right, no phone call!! One final note ladies, if you don't like starring at naked women all over the beach (with their butt RIGHT in your face) don't go here!!"
reviews.title: HORRIBLE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice boutique hotel recently acquired by Hilton but the service is not great. We had numerous small problems nothing major but I think it will be a while until they get the kinks out.
reviews.title: Nice location and hotel with poor service

reviews.text: My wife, 2 kids (2 and 4 years old) and I stayed at the Hilton Bentley Beach in early April. Our overall experience was good, but we had to work at it. When we booked we noticed that the Hilton website stated that there was construction next door. We called the hotel to check on this and they said there wasn't any construction. Anyway, when we checked in we say the rather large condo being built next door so we requested a room away from the construction zone. The front desk fiddled around for a while on an "upgrade" and eventually gave us our room key and off we went. Anyway, we were in a tiny "suite" about 10 feet from the contruction site. Our view was of metal beams and a construction dude, which is not really why you spend a decent amount of money on an oceanfront property. The condo being built is a highrise condo literally 10 or 20 feet from the Hilton Bentley. If you have that view it's not going to be the same experience as being on the non-construction side of the property. Anyway, we called and compained and they moved us to our original room...which was literally a bed, a TV and a bathroom. It was one of the smallest hotel rooms I have seen in a while. We complained again (we are not habitual complainers at hotels but it was very bizarre) and eventually they moved us to a really nice suite on the other side of the hotel - marble bathroom, nice kitchen, etc. (others have written about this and they descriptions are accurate). The difference between our final room and the two others we saw was VERY dramatic and made the difference between a really nice stay and one where I would have felt thoroughly ripped off. The pool is small but nice and warm and not crowded and the beach is just across the road. The kids loved going back and forth between them, so from that perspective it was great. We didn't mind being on the quiet side of SOBE but if you want to be in the center of things this is not the hotel to be at. They have a nice fitness center with bottled water, etc. and also give you bottles of water at the pool. It was a nice touch. The wireless internet was down most of our stay- something about cut wires. Anyway, that was repaired after a few days. Overall I don't think I would stay here again because there are many other options that don't have the risks involved (i.e., construction site, some very undesirable rooms, etc.).
reviews.title: Hilton Bentley Beach is cool...if you get the right room.

likes.liked: — Location and our room (in the end, after seeing 2 other very undesirable rooms)
likes.disliked: — Construction next door; chances of getting a really bad room (clean but tiny)

reviews.text: We stayed here on points for four nights late March. We were impressed with the rooms and hotel, however the internet wasn't working ,and they weren't too concerned with getting it working anytime soon ("hopefully tomorrow"). There is also no bar, restaurant, or room service. If you want these things, this isn't the place for you. The Marriot next door seems really nice, we walked through and went to their pool area. Our room didn't have a tub, and the lighting in the bathroom is terrible, my wife said she couldn't see in the mirror to do the make up thing. Also the AC was loud when running, affecting sleep. Prime One Twelve across the street is a very good restuarant, as is Big Pink. Noise from construction next door was not a factor, you hardly notice it. Watch your step going onto patio, there is a 4" high metal frame that I hit accidentally and almost broke a toe. Overall, a nice place, but until they get a bar/room service/internet access, etc....
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, lacking some things though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 days in early March using Hilton 'rewards' so admittedly it was ' a freebie' . At the time we booked, prices were around $900 per night ($500 'discounted') and much as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, had I been paying that sort of money I would have been a little disappointed with my choice.
reviews.title: Excellent if you get a good rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night March 25, 2008. I am a Hilton Honors member and used a ton of points to get this room. Be aware this hotel has NO double rooms. Which is what i needed. So i paid extra and got upgraded to a suite 402. The hotel is about 15 mins away from the cruise port or the airport. It is at the END of the Ocean Drive Strip. I did not particularly like this although its quiet, it is more deserted and required more walking/cabs/shuttles. The Suite was magnificent! It was very large with a living room and dining room area, a full kitchen with a full fridge stocked with evrything you could want. The King sized bed was huge and the sofa bed was very comfy. The bathroom was very nice all marble with a jacuzzi tub but no shower curtain so made for a very wet floor after showers. It had a long wraparound balcony with access to the hot tub and a mini pool. The weather was not really nice when i was there so i enjoyed soaking in the hot tub all day. They have complimentary internet access in the lobby and a nice and affordable(compared to SoBe prices) restaurnt downstairs. It was a couple a blocks away from Big Pink, TGIF, around the corner from a Starbucks and a few other nice restuarants. All in all it was a very nice stay and i would stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice Suites at the Hilton Bentley

reviews.text: My wife and I booked a reward stay over the Easter holiday. Overall the reviews are spot on about the Bentley Beach it has it good qualities and it has it down sides. The hotel is clean and the rooms are nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Rainy Easter Visit

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Loews South Beach and Ritz Carlton Key Biscayne and this Hotel isn't at that standard, but for a reward stay it was ok.
reviews.title: Liars, Liars, Liars

reviews.text: All the expecifications that I request at time of the reservation they were not taken in consideration. Even-though they have told me that it wont be a problem wiht any of them. Early chek-in-,NOT...highest floor-NOT.....oceanfront suite-NOT........Try to talk to the Gen. Mgr. he was completly mediocre, unprofessional and did not solve or go around the problem with my reservation. Bottom line DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!! they are liers and they will laugh at your face.
reviews.title: Awesome! Great service and rooms. Beautiful beach.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We were a little nervous because it was hard to find a hotel with positive reviews and at a fair price. We decided to ignore the negatives on this one and give it a shot. What a great decision. The stay was fantastic. Rooms super clean, and service just great. Walking distance to Big Pink for breakfast, and a little market to buy groceries, liquor, etc to take to the beach. It takes 3 minutes to get to the beautiful beach. Chairs and towels are provided for a mandatory $10 a day fee so use it because you are paying it no matter what.
reviews.title: hip, cozy and friendly and overall great experience!

likes.disliked: — pool not heated for those chilly nights
